748. Booth Pheobe Elizabeth (Mrs. Herbert James S)r.
SASKATCHEWAN ARCHIVES QUESTIONNAIRE

PIONEER EXPERIENCES & GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

NOTE: Please print all proper names and places names in capital letters. If you are not sure the name is correct as you have given it, please say so.

It is quite acceptable to have someone else do the writing at your dictation.

1. Your full name: PHOEBE ELIZABETH BAUER
2. Your address: RANGER, SASKATCHEWAN
3. Date: SEPTEMBER 5, 1925
4. Where were you born? (Give name of place and country): CHARLOTTE COUNTY, NEW BRUNSWICK, CANADA
5. What was your father's name and occupation?: RICHARD DANIEL BLACKBURN, Farmer
6. When did you come to Saskatchewan? (Give month and Year): MAY 1904
7. Mention any other places where you lived before coming to Saskatchewan, giving dates wherever possible:

8. How old were you when you first came to Western Canada? (You do not need to answer this question if you would rather not or you may use "I was a small child", "I was in my teens", etc.): 13 Years
9. What were your reasons for coming West?

The west was just being opened up, and my parents had heard previously how everything there was excepting the land was for free, and they thought if they could make a little start here and sell the farm in New Brunswick, come west.

Through other people mainly one to be mentioned was the late Senator WILLIAM DELL PERLEY.

WILLIAM DELL PERLEY
PIONEER EXPERIENCES - A GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

NOTE: Please print all proper names and place names in capital letters. If they are not sure the name is correct as you have given it, please say so.

It is quite acceptable to have someone else do the writing at your dictation.

1. Your full name: PHOEBE ELIZABETH BAUH
2. Your address: RANGER, SASKATCHEWAN
3. Date: SEPTEMBER 5, 1926
4. Where were you born? (Give name of place and country): CHARLOTTE COUNTY, NEW BRUNSWICK, CANADA.
5. What was your father's name and occupation?: RICHARD DANIEL BLACKBURN, FARMER.
6. When did you come to Saskatchewan? (Give month and Year): MAY 1904
7. Mention any other places where you lived before coming to Saskatchewan, giving dates wherever possible:

8. How old were you when you first came to Western Canada? (You do not need to answer this question if you would rather not or you may use a small child, I was in my teens, etc.): 13 YEARS
9. What were your reasons for coming West?

The west was just being opened up, and my parents had heard about the land being free and they thought if they could make a little start so sold the farm in New Brunswick and came west.

Through other people mainly me to be mentioned was the late Mr. Perley.

WILLIAM DELL PERLEY.
2.

11. What did your friends and relatives think of your decision to come to Western Canada?

Thought it a wild goose chase.

12. Did you travel by yourself or with a party (family, friends or other group)?

Did not travel family. Mother, two brothers.

13. What means of transportation did you use?

Train. Winter and spring.

Railroad by Colonist car.

14. What incidents of the journey West do you remember? (People you met on the way, meetings with Indians, adventures on the journey, accidents or other excitement, etc.)

15. Where did you first stay when you arrived in Saskatchewan?

Worked for the late DELL HART, a cousin.

16. Where did you settle or take up land?

Parents took up land in the CREEKMAN district.

17. Mention any other places where you have lived since coming to Saskatchewan.

18. How did you earn a living before coming to Western Canada? How, after you came?

After coming to SASKATCHEWAN I earned my living as a domestic servant until the time of my marriage.
11. What did your friends and relatives think of your decision to come to Western Canada?

Thought it a wild goose chase.

12. Did you travel by yourself or with a party (family, friends or other group)?

Some sisters and their mother, two brothers.

13. What means of transportation did you use?

Railroad by Colonist car.

14. What incidents of the journey West do you remember? (People you met on the way, meetings with Indians, adventures on the journey, accidents or other excitement, etc.)

15. Where did you first stay when you arrived in Saskatchewan?

I worked for the late DELL HART, a cousin of Senator PERLEY at his farm near CREEKMAN.

16. Where did you settle or take up land?

Parents took up land in the CREEKMAN district.

17. Mention any other places where you have lived since coming to Saskatchewan.

18. How did you earn a living before coming to Western Canada? How, after you came?

After coming to SASKATCHEWAN I earned my living as a domestic servant until the time of my marriage.
19. How often did you write to relatives or friends in your old home?
   once or twice a month.

20. If you got married, give the name of your husband or wife along with the
    date and place of marriage. HERBERT JAMES BOOTH

21. Did anyone else come to Saskatchewan because of your recommendation? Yes

22. If other members of your family (brothers, sisters, parents, etc.) came West,
    tell when they came and where they settled.

23. Is there any particular experience of pioneer days that stands out in your
    memory which you would like to record?

24. Did you travel about much in the early years? (For business, attending
    church, visiting friends, etc.) How often? How far?
    Sometimes by horse & buggy or by team wagon
    We traveled a good deal and would take
    in anything from a church affair to a dance
    In concert, within a radius of 10 or 15 miles.
19. How often did you write to relatives or friends in your old home?
   - Twice a month.

20. If you got married, give the name of your husband or wife along with the date and place of marriage.
   - Herbert James Booth

21. Did anyone else come to Saskatchewan because of your recommendation? If so, please list them.
   - Yes

22. If other members of your family (brothers, sisters, parents, etc.) came West, tell when they came and where they settled.

23. In there any particular experience of pioneer days that stands out in your memory which you would like to recount?

24. Did you travel about much in the early years? (For business, attending church, visiting friends, etc.) How often? How far?
   - Mostly by horse & buggy or by team wagon. Sometimes by stoneboat. We traveled a good deal and would take in anything from a church affair to a dance in concert, within a radius of 10 to 15 miles.
25. When was the first car used in the community? 1917

26. If you owned a car before 1917, when did you buy it? What make?

27. Where was your trading center? How far from your home?

WOKSLEY

28. Did you continue to trade there? (Indicate any changes due to new towns appearing, better means of travel, etc.)

After the railroad was built from Regina & Arcola we traded at Creelman, that was in the fall of 1904.

29. How often did you shop in the early days? about twice a month

30. When (if ever) did people in your district first start going to town regularly on Saturdays?

Around 1914.

31. When (if ever) did you first begin to buy through the mail order catalogues? What kind of articles did you buy? In this way? Indicate also what fraction of your total purchases were by mail. Rates and charges in the proportion of purchases made by mail order since the pioneer period.

1905 mainly all dry goods and we still do.

32. When did you first have a telephone and what company provided it? 1910

CREELMAN KURALT TELEPHONE COMPANY

33. When you came to Saskatchewan the first time was it with the idea of staying permanently? Or did you make up your mind after trying it out? When did you make this decision?

When we first came
25. When was the first car used in the community? 1917

26. If you owned a car before 1917, when did you buy it? What make?

27. Where was your trading centre? How far from your house?

28. Did you continue to trade there? (Indicate any changes due to new towns appearing; better means of travel, etc.)

After the railroad was built from Regina to Arcola we had a store at Creelman, that was in the fall of 1904.

29. How often did you shop in the early days? About once a month

30. When (if ever) did people in your district first start going to town regularly on Saturdays?

Around 1914.

31. When (if ever) did you first begin to buy through the mail order catalogues? What kind of articles did you buy in this way? Indicate also what fraction of your total purchases were made by mail order since the pioneer period.

1905 mainly all dry goods and we still do.

32. When did you first have a telephone and what company provided it? 1910

33. When you came to Saskatchewan the first time was it with the idea of staying permanently? Or did you make up your mind after trying it out? When did you make this decision?

When we first came.
34. Did any people move away from your district prior to 1950? What reasons did they have for moving?

35. Did many people move away during the 1950s? Did many return?

36. If you or some members of your family have held public offices or been active in any organizations, mention its name, giving dates whenever possible.

37. If you or any of your family or friends were willing to hire or do something in the district, mention it here (e.g., churches, clubs, organizing the first lodge, etc.).

38. How did the places in your community get their names? (School districts, post offices, villages, railway stations, creeks, hills, etc.) Try to give (1) name and occupation of person responsible; (2) reason for change; (3) any changes in names since the first name was given; date and reason for change. Give facts of new names as above in (1), (2), (3).
34. Did any people move away from your district prior to 1947? What reasons did they have for moving?

With the idea of making a little money and then moving on to BC where they would have a better climate or back in their old homestead.

35. Did any people move into your district?

Yes quite a few moved our way we well among them but not many returned to the same district.

36. If you or some member of your family have held public offices or been active in any organizations, mention it briefly, giving dates wherever possible.

37. If you or any of your family or friends were killed to live or go somewhere else in the district mention it here giving dates whenever possible (such as overing the first anniversary, wedding, etc.)

38. How did the places in your community get their names? (School districts, post offices, villages, railway stations, creeks, hills, etc.) Try to give (1) name and occupation of person responsible for (2) date of settlement of this name (3) date of the settlement (4) any changes in names since the first name was given (date and reason for change). Give facts of new name as above in (1), (2), (3).
Questions regarding historical source materials:

Do you have in your possession or do you know the whereabouts of diaries, old letters, old photos, and programs, old books of community organizations, old pamphlets, old photographs, written recollections and reminiscences? (Describe)

Would you or the person who owns them either:

1. be willing to lend them to the Provincial Archivist for copying?
2. be willing to present them to the Archives Division of the Legislative Library, Regina, or the Archives Office at the University in Saskatoon?

(Indicate your preference, if any) ……………………..

If you have children or grandchildren, please give their names, where they live and occupations.

We have six children and 21 grandchildren. If we would take quite a chance, I name them all, but believe that was done in my husband’s absence so will not risk it.

What do you think are the most important changes in your community since you first came West?

The automobile and the combine have been important. The roads have been improved, that is the main highway but the crossroads are worse now, even than they were forty years ago.

Please give the names and addresses of other pioneers who could answer this questionnaire.

Do not send any more questionnaires, please.

P.E. Booth

If someone else has filled in this questionnaire for you, please have this person give name and address here:
39. Questions regarding historical source materials:
Do you have in your possession or do you know the whereabouts of diaries, old letters, old posters and photographs, minute books of community organizations? (Describe), written recollections and reminiscences? (Describe).

Would you or the person who owns them either:
(1) be willing to lend them to the Provincial Archivist for copying?
(2) be willing to present them to the Archives Division of the Legislative Library, Regina, or the Archives Office at the University in Saskatoon?

40. If you have children or grandchildren, please give their names, where they live and occupations.

we have six children and 21 grandchildren. If we would take quite a few of them all but I believe that was done in my husband's absence so will not submit.

41. What do you think are the most important changes in your community since you first came here?

The automobile and the combine have been important. The roads have been improved that is the main highway but the crossroads are worse now than when they were forty years ago.

Please give the names and addresses of other persons who could answer this questionnaire.

Do not send any more questionnaires, please.
